issues.description: README states 'Range: 0–10' for retryCount but the code enforces 1–5.
issues.reproduction_result: Passing values outside 1–5 (for example 0 or 10) will cause the function to throw at runtime.
issues.fix_explanation: Update README to state the correct allowed range (1–5) to match input.ts (lines enforcing range).

issues.description: README documents default retryCount as 1 but input.ts uses a default of 3.
issues.reproduction_result: A developer relying on the documented default (1) will be surprised; actual runs without an explicit value use 3.
issues.fix_explanation: Change README default to 3 so documentation matches code (see input.ts default assignment).

issues.description: Example shows startService({ retryCount: 0 }) — 0 is outside the allowed range in the code and will throw an error.
issues.reproduction_result: Following the example causes a runtime error: "retryCount must be between 1 and 5".
issues.fix_explanation: Replace the example with a valid value (e.g. retryCount: 1 or 3) and add a note that out-of-range values throw an error.

issues.issue_type: Broken setup flow / missing project scripts
issues.description: README instructs to run 'npm install' and 'npm start', but the repository contains no package.json or npm start script and therefore those commands are not reproducible.
issues.reproduction_result: Running 'npm install' or 'npm start' in the repo will not produce the documented result (no dependencies to install, and 'npm start' will fail).
issues.fix_explanation: Document how to run the module (provide a small runner or show npx/ts-node commands) or add a package.json with a start script. The fixed README provides a reproducible runner example.

issues.description: `input.ts` only exports `startService` and does not call it; there is no runnable default entrypoint (so 'run the service' is not possible without adding a runner).
issues.reproduction_result: Executing the TypeScript file directly (even with ts-node) produces no output because the function is never invoked.
issues.fix_explanation: Either add an entrypoint script that calls `startService()` or update documentation to show how to create/run a small runner (README_fixed.md includes the runner example).
